description.narrative: The objective of the project is to enhance all season road connectivity to agricultural market centers in selected Districts.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Amended and Restated FA Schedule 2 Section V.3 | Description :Undertakings- Recipient's Contribution: TheRecipient shall deposit into the Counterpart Fund Account, not later than 90 days after the Effective Date of the FA, an initialadvance for purposes of carrying out Parts A (3) and A (6) of the Project and any resettlement activities, as detailed in the CashFlow Maintenance Plan, and shall thereafter replenish the Counterpart Fund Account. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :Amended and Restated FA Schedule 2 Section V.4 | Description :Undertakings- Recipient's Contribution: TheRecipient shall ensure that funds deposited into the Counterpart Fund Account shall be used exclusively to finance expendituresunder the Project and any resettlement activities under Parts A (3) and A (6) of the Project. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :Amended and Restated FA Schedule 2 Section I.C.3 | Description :The Recipient shall cause RTDA to, not laterthan May 31 of each year, prepare and furnish to the Association, an annual program of activities proposed for implementation underthe Project during the following Fiscal Year, together with a proposed budget for the purpose. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Amended and Restated FA Schedule 2 Section V.1 | Description :Undertakings- Recipient's Contribution. TheRecipient shall cause RTDA to prepare and furnish to the Association, on or before May 31 in each year, or such other date as maybe agreed with the Association, a proposed cash flow based maintenance plan for such year, detailing the maintenance works underParts A(3) and A(6) of the Project proposed to be carried out by the Recipient. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Amended and Restated FA Schedule 2 Section V.2 | Description :Undertakings- Recipient's Contribution: Forpurposes of the Project, the Recipient shall maintain at all times during Project implementation, in Rwandan Francs, in itsnational bank, a separate account under terms and conditions acceptable to the Association (â€œCounterpart Fund Accountâ€?), tomeet the cost of carrying out Parts A (3) and A (6) of the Project and any resettlement activities. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :Amended and Restated FA Schedule 2 Section V.5 | Description :Undertakings- Recipient's Contribution: Forpurposes of implementing Part A (3) and Part A (6) of the Project, the Recipient shall enter into multi-year maintenance contracts,in form and substance satisfactory to the Association, with contractors whose qualifications, experience, and terms of referenceshall be satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :GA Schedule 2 Section I.C.5 | Description :The Recipient shall cause RTDA to, not later than six (6) monthsafter the Effective Date of the Grant Agreement, enter into implementation agreements with each Selected District detailing mutualresponsibilities for the implementation of the Project and detailing other terms and conditions as may be approved by the WorldBank (â€œDistrict Implementation Agreementâ€?). | Due Date :10-Sep-2018

Finance Agreement :GA Schedule 2 Section V.1 | Description :Undertakings- Recipient's Contribution. The Recipient shall cause RTDAto prepare and furnish to the World Bank, on or before May 31 in each year, or such other date as may be agreed with theAssociation, a proposed cash flow based maintenance plan for such year, detailing the maintenance works under Parts A (3) and A (6)of the Project proposed to be carried out by the Recipient. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :GA Schedule 2 Section V.2 | Description :Undertakings- Recipient's Contribution: For purposes of the Project,the Recipient shall maintain at all times during Project implementation, in Rwandan Francs, in its national bank, a separateaccount under terms and conditions acceptable to the World Bank (â€œCounterpart Fund Accountâ€?), to meet the cost of carrying outParts A (3) and A (6) of the Project and any resettlement activities. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :GA Schedule 2 Section V.3 | Description :Undertakings- Recipient's Contribution: The Recipient shall depositinto the Counterpart Fund Account, not later than 90 days after the Effective Date of the Grant Agreement, an initial advance forpurposes of carrying out Parts A (3) and A (6) of the Project and any resettlement activities, as detailed in the Cash FlowMaintenance Plan, and shall thereafter replenish the Counterpart Fund Account. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :GA Schedule 2 Section V.4 | Description :Undertakings- Recipient's Contribution: The Recipient shall ensure thatfunds deposited into the Counterpart Fund Account shall be used exclusively to finance expenditures under the Project and anyresettlement activities under Parts A (3) and A (6) of the Project. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

Finance Agreement :GA Schedule 2 Section V.5 | Description :Undertakings- Recipient's Contribution: For purposes of implementingPart A (3) and Part A (6) of the Project, the Recipient shall enter into multi-year maintenance contracts, in form and substancesatisfactory to the World Bank, with contractors whose qualifications, experience, and terms of reference shall be satisfactory tothe World Bank. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :GA Schedule 2, Section I.C.3 | Description :The Recipient shall cause RTDA to, not later than May 31 of eachyear, prepare and furnish to the World Bank, an annual program of activities proposed for implementation under the Project duringthe following Fiscal Year, together with a proposed budget for the purpose. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Agreement (Financing Agreement (FA) Schedule 2 Section I) | Description :The Recipientshall: (a) cause RTDA to provide technical support to MINAGRI; and (b) cause MINAGRI not later than six (6) months after theEffective Date, to enter into a Project Implementation Agreement with RTDA, in form and substance satisfactory to the Association,setting forth RTDA's role and responsibilities with respect to the carrying out of Part B of the Project. | Due Date :24-Jan-2015

title.narrative: Number of agricultural marketing centers connected by all season road
Percentage of women employed in established LCAs
Rural/feeder roads with readily available design and bidding document
Roads in good and fair condition as a share of total classified roads
Share of rural population with access to an all-season road
Number of rural people with access to an all-season road
Reduction in travel time per kilometer
Size of the total classified network
Business plan for rural/feeder roads development prepared
Project implemented according to planned time and budget
Percentage of trained women trained on gender relations, healthy relationships and non-violent conflict resolution, HIV and STD
Number of Early Warning Systems (EWS) stations installed along rural roads network
Workers trained on gender relations, healthy relationships and non-violent conflict resolution, HIV and STD during roads rehabilitation/maintenance (% of trained workers)
Road safety sensitization campaigns conducted for schools, health centers and markets along project roads
Landslide management plan developed and operationalized
